title: Innovative Development of European Areas by Fostering Transnational Knowledge Development
abstract: Certain innovation processes cannot be realized without people and their ideas. The project focuses on development of strategies that will safeguard human capital for these processes and establishes transnational cooperation for coping with this challenge, especially in the sector of engineering technology and science. Project partnership decided to look for a holistic European solutions by overcoming predominantly regionally focused methods when developing innovation strategies. The different regional approaches will be therefore improved, good practice examples defined and new opportunities for its further development determined. The project partnership consists of experienced and competent partners from the participating regions representing development agencies, business support and innovation agencies, as well as municipalities and universities from all 8 CE countries. It initiates the formation of co-operative structures between universities, educational institutions and regional decision makers, which constitute stable networks based on structural funding until the end of the project.

motivations: Innovation processes are hindered by the lack of human capital and transnational cooperation, particularly in the engineering technology and science sectors.
Regional approaches to innovation strategies are limited and need to be improved and integrated into a holistic European solution.
objectives: Develop strategies to safeguard human capital for innovation processes.
Establish transnational cooperation to address the challenges of innovation development.
Improve regional approaches to innovation strategies and identify good practice examples and new opportunities.
methods: Form co-operative structures between universities, educational institutions, and regional decision makers.
Initiate stable networks based on structural funding.
Bring together experienced partners from development agencies, business support and innovation agencies, municipalities, and universities from 8 CE countries.
results: Enhance innovation development in European areas through transnational knowledge development.
Improve regional innovation strategies and promote good practice examples.
Establish stable networks and co-operative structures for sustainable innovation development.
llama_json.research_subject: Transnational knowledge development for innovative growth in European areas

motivations: Innovation processes require human capital, which is a challenge to safeguard, especially in the sectors of engineering technology and science.
Current innovation strategies are predominantly regionally focused, limiting their effectiveness and scope.
objectives: Develop strategies to safeguard human capital for innovation processes through transnational cooperation.
Improve regional approaches, define good practice examples, and determine new opportunities for further development of innovation strategies.
Initiate the formation of cooperative structures between universities, educational institutions, and regional decision makers.
methods: Establish a project partnership consisting of experienced and competent partners from various sectors and regions.
Focus on holistic European solutions, moving beyond regionally focused methods.
Form stable networks based on structural funding until the end of the project.
results: Enhanced safeguarding of human capital for innovation processes.
Improved and broadened innovation strategies through transnational cooperation.
Established cooperative structures and networks among key stakeholders in innovation.
openai_json.research_subject: Transnational knowledge development for innovation in European areas

motivations: Innovation processes depend on human capital and ideas, requiring strategies to safeguard and develop this critical resource.
Current innovation strategies are predominantly regionally focused, limiting the potential for broader European collaboration and knowledge exchange.
objectives: Develop strategies to safeguard human capital for innovation processes, particularly in engineering technology and science sectors.
Establish transnational cooperation and holistic European solutions to overcome regionally focused innovation methods.
Create stable cooperative networks between universities, educational institutions, and regional decision makers.
methods: Form partnerships across 8 Central European countries involving development agencies, business support organizations, innovation agencies, municipalities, and universities.
Identify and share good practice examples while improving different regional approaches to innovation.
Build cooperative structures between academic institutions and regional decision makers supported by structural funding.
results: Enhanced transnational knowledge development and innovation capacity across European regions.
Establishment of stable networks between universities, educational institutions, and regional decision makers.
Development of holistic European innovation strategies that transcend regional limitations.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Transnational cooperation for human capital development in European innovation processes
